intro: Trigonia coppenamensis, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages. The plant features showy yellow flowers with four petals arranged in a cross shape, typical of the family. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Trigonia coppenamensis is typically found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
